alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 12:14AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY ALONG THE COAST TILLAMOOK NORTHWARD THROUGH THE SOUTH WASHINGTON COAST... At 1208 AM PST, latest radar imagery and webcams were showing a batch of snow showers just about to move onshore into the North Oregon Coast. With temperatures near or slightly below freezing, this snow may stick on roads, especially on untreated roads, bridges, and overpasses. Even locations that do not see snow showers may still have issues with wet roads refreezing overnight. Those driving along Highway 101 and other roads northward from Tillamook should be prepared for snow covered roads and wintry driving conditions. Snow showers will remain possible through early Friday morning.
